org.apache.mesos.scheduler

Class SchedulerDriverFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.scheduler.SchedulerDriverFactory

  • public class SchedulerDriverFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    Factory class for creating MesosSchedulerDrivers.

      protected SchedulerDriver createInternal(Scheduler scheduler, FrameworkInfo frameworkInfo, java.lang.String masterUrl, Credential credential)
      Broken out into a separate function to allow testing with custom SchedulerDrivers.
      protected boolean isSideChannelActive()
      Returns whether it appears that side channel auth should be used when creating the SchedulerDriver.

      • SchedulerDriverFactory

        public SchedulerDriverFactory()

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public SchedulerDriver create(Scheduler scheduler,
                              FrameworkInfo frameworkInfo,
                              java.lang.String masterUrl)
        Creates and returns a new SchedulerDriver without a credential secret.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The Framework Scheduler implementation which should receive callbacks from the SchedulerDriver
        frameworkInfo - The FrameworkInfo which describes the framework implementation. The 'principal' field MUST be populated and non-empty
        masterUrl - The URL of the currently active Mesos Master, of the form "zk://host/mesos"
        Returns:
        A SchedulerDriver configured with the provided info
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if FrameworkInfo.principal is unset or empty when authentication is needed

      • create

        public SchedulerDriver create(Scheduler scheduler,
                              FrameworkInfo frameworkInfo,
                              java.lang.String masterUrl,
                              byte[] credentialSecret)
        Creates and returns a new SchedulerDriver with the provided credential secret.
        Parameters:
        scheduler - The Framework Scheduler implementation which should receive callbacks from the SchedulerDriver
        frameworkInfo - The FrameworkInfo which describes the framework implementation. The 'principal' field MUST be populated and non-empty
        masterUrl - The URL of the currently active Mesos Master, of the form "zk://host/mesos"
        credentialSecret - The secret to be included in the framework org.apache.mesos.Protos.Credential, ignored if null/empty
        Returns:
        A SchedulerDriver configured with the provided info
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if FrameworkInfo.principal is unset or empty when authentication is needed

      • createInternal

        protected SchedulerDriver createInternal(Scheduler scheduler,
                                         FrameworkInfo frameworkInfo,
                                         java.lang.String masterUrl,
                                         Credential credential)
        Broken out into a separate function to allow testing with custom SchedulerDrivers.

      • isSideChannelActive

        protected boolean isSideChannelActive()
        Returns whether it appears that side channel auth should be used when creating the SchedulerDriver. Side channel auth may take the form of Bouncer-based framework authentication or potentially other methods in the future (eg Kerberos). Broken out into a separate function to allow easy customization in tests.
